Articles.Content:
Stock submarine and kind of street magic. Place it on the water with VesselMover or add wheels and move on it, drop first (protect/transport) stage. Balance it, moving ore between tanks.

1 - dive/go to surface
0 - reverse engines
Up to 40 knots, about 300 km range (at 15 knots)
 

craft

if this link dead, tell me, i'll fix it
 

video


 

Edited December 4, 2015 by Vaisman
forum migration
Very cool boat, reminds me at the german type XII series... greetings :)
Very cool, how does it sink/surface?

This is street magic. I've find, how to change buoyancy from positive to negative and back,

I've used cargo bays for it :) Edited November 16, 2015 by Vaisman

I've got this idea about opening and closing bays under the water, I noticed when I tried to put a ramp down in the water it affected my seaplanes floatation, but because it was very floaty I didn't pay much attention to it.

Try to place ore tanks inside, and opened cargo bay will float and closed will sink

This is magic! :), and probably it work with service bays too

[quote name='Vaisman']Try to place ore tanks inside, and opened cargo bay will float and closed will sink

This is magic! :), and probably it work with service bays too[/QUOTE]

Fantastic discovery Vaisman! I will give this a go,

[quote name='Vaisman']Try to place ore tanks inside, and opened cargo bay will float and closed will sink

This is magic! :), and probably it work with service bays too[/QUOTE]
Ha! Now we can actually roleplay like we're flooding the tanks! My family will probably get annoyed at me occasionally screaming "ALAAAARM!!" and "Flood!" and "Blow tanks!" and "One, three, five, both sides!" and all the other stuff they say in [I]Das Boot[/I].

Have some rep. Take it all. Hell, take my money. If you need it, I can have my arm or leg amputated for you!

[quote name='Majorjim']Fantastic discovery Vaisman! I will give this a go,[/QUOTE]

True, thats a very cool method! I see a U-boat career for me waiting in the depths...:wink:
